Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Patient ID: [REDACTED]
Date of procedure: [REDACTED]
Attending physician: Dr. S. Moreno
Assistants: Interventional pulmonology fellow; cytopathology technologist; radiology technologist.

Pre-procedure diagnosis: 16 mm peripheral left lower lobe lateral basal segment nodule with intermediate pre-test probability of malignancy.
Post-procedure diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma of the lung based on frozen-section biopsy.
Indication: Same-session diagnosis and local treatment of a peripheral lung cancer in a patient with cardiomyopathy and prohibitive surgical risk.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 8.0 mm endotracheal tube; ASA class III.

Procedures performed:
1. Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy with radial EBUS confirmation.
2. Transbronchial cryobiopsy of left lower lobe nodule with frozen-section analysis.
3. Transbronchial microwave ablation of left lower lobe nodule using Emprint catheter.

Procedure description: The navigation bronchoscope was advanced to the left lower lobe following registration of the planning CT. Radial EBUS demonstrated a concentric hypoechoic lesion. Two transbronchial cryobiopsies were obtained and submitted for frozen section, which confirmed invasive adenocarcinoma. Perilesional hemorrhage caused mild blurring of the lesion margins on fluoroscopy. A CrossCountry needle was then advanced into the lesion and an extended working channel placed. An Emprint catheter was introduced and a single 10-minute ablation performed. Post-ablation cone-beam CT showed a ground-glass ablation zone encompassing the biopsy cavity with an estimated minimal margin of approximately 5 mm, though interpretation was limited by hemorrhage-related opacities. Bronchoscopy at the end of the case demonstrated oozing in the lateral basal subsegment, which resolved with suctioning and topical iced saline.

Estimated blood loss: 20 mL.
Complications: Mild, self-limited perilesional hemorrhage; no pneumothorax.
Disposition: Extubated in the operating room and admitted overnight for observation; oncology follow-up arranged with surveillance CT at 3 months.
